Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Pexidartinib for Pain Relief in Tenosynovial Giant Cell Tumor

Trial_Design.evidence: randomized 1:1 to receive pexidartinib (n=61) or placebo (n=59)

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults with symptomatic TGCT, randomized 1:1 to receive pexidartinib (n=61) or placebo (n=59) for 24 weeks.

Intervention.evidence: randomized 1:1 to receive pexidartinib (n=61) or placebo (n=59) for 24 weeks.

Objective.evidence: evaluated the efficacy of pexidartinib in reducing pain in adults with tenosynovial giant cell tumor (TGCT) not amenable to surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was a â‰¥30% decrease in weekly mean worst-pain NRS score with <30% increase in narcotic use from baseline to week 25.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was via an integrated web response system, with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: randomized 1:1 to receive pexidartinib (n=61) or placebo (n=59)

Number_Analysed.evidence: Pain response was observed in 31% (19/61) of the pexidartinib group versus 15% (9/59) of the placebo group

Result_Outcome.evidence: Pain response was observed in 31% (19/61) of the pexidartinib group versus 15% (9/59) of the placebo group (p=0.03).
